pages.title: ⍟ Ten of Pentacles ⍟
pages.text: Spirit of Wealth$(br)     ☿ Mercury in ♍ Virgo

Now we see a diagram of the universe, a symbol of the whole of manifestation.$(br)  Ten pentacles are arranged on an ancient diagram called the Tree of Life. This figure is the secret basis of the whole system on which the Tarot is based.$(br)  Every pentacle symbolizes an emanation through which infinite spirit reveals itself, creating the metaphysical realms and ultimately physical reality: nature, the body, the need for work.

Spirit is transmuted through the realms and descends into matter, reaching at last complete stagnation.$(br)  Acquired wealth, being inert, will be dissipated or lost unless put to further use instead of mere accumulation.$(br)  Here is a great and final solidification, the accumulated work of the previous cards.$(br)  This card is in fact a hieroglyph of the cycle of creation and regeneration.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Wealth, inheritance, security, sometimes family matters.$(br)  Reaching the highest point, retirement.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Chance, uncertainty, loss.$(br)  Going beyond what you have, looking for new beginnings, or new adventures in life.
